item.title: 'Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled' Powerslides Onto Switch, PS4 and Xbox One Next Year - Forbes
item.description:
'Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled' Powerslides Onto Switch, PS4 and Xbox One Next Year  Forbes

Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled First came Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy, followed recently by the amazing Spyro Reignited Trilogy, and now we have yet another retro-inspired remake on our hands. Even though it feels like Activision is just mining our childhoods for gold at this point, I’m not complaining, because what we’re getting in return is just too damn good. Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled After much speculation and a strange furry delivery earlier this week, Activision has officially confirmed and announced a high definition reboot of Naughty Dog’s excellent PS1 go-karting romp. Dub...

item.title: What can urban households do to help protect vulnerable native animals? - ABC News
item.description:
What can urban households do to help protect vulnerable native animals?  ABC News

Urban backyards are an important habitat as part of wider efforts to protect native animals, conservationists have said. Ian Darbyshire from the Foundation for National Parks and Wildlife said Adelaide Hills residents, for example, could do simple things to help preserve the region's southern brown bandicoot population, which is in decline. "Plant some native species — keep your own pets under control, talk to your neighbours [and] see if they will do the same," he said. "[People can] create some corridors throughout the Mount Lofty Ranges [Adelaide Hills] so the animals can move around, ma...

item.title: Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy review, PS4: A classic reborn - The Independent
item.description:
Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy review, PS4: A classic reborn  The Independent

Before Naughty Dog created the wise-cracking adventurer Nathan Drake and threw him into numerous set pieces in the acclaimed Uncharted series, the developer produced another PlayStation star called Crash Bandicoot. It was 1994 and Jason Rubin and Andy Gavin had decided to work on a 3D action-platform game in which the main character would run into the screen, tackle obstacles and collect things. Two years later, and with the developer having created its own programming language and compression software in a bid to get the game running fluidly on the PSOne, the game was ready. It sold six mi...

item.title: 2 killed in ultra-light crash (2) - Agenzia Ansa
item.description:
2 killed in ultra-light crash (2)  Agenzia Ansa

(ANSA) - Cagliari, July 5 - Two people died when an ultra-light plane crashed into the sea near the southwest coast of Sardinia Wednesday. They were the 50-year-old male pilot and his 40-year-old female passenger, police said. The plane crashed just off the beach of Portoscuso. Divers are recovering the bodies. The plane took off from Ussana outside Cagliari, police said. Read the full article on ANSA English

item.title: Knack 2: How developers came back after one of the hottest PS4 games was met with cool reception - The Independent
item.description:
Knack 2: How developers came back after one of the hottest PS4 games was met with cool reception  The Independent

Knack was the first PlayStation 4 game ever seen, for many people. And for a while it seemed like many people might never see it again. The game was a launch title for the console in 2013, making it one of the most visible games in the world. Now Sony is bringing the sequel – a game that comes with all the same focus, and a lot of extra baggage. The first version of Knack was envisioned as a game in the mould of Crash Bandicoot: simple enough while still offering complexity that would reveal itself with time, and a game that could be dropped in and out of. Like Crash Bandicoot, Sony hoped t...

item.title: PS4's 'Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy' Has Crushed My Wife's Spirit - Forbes Now
item.description:
PS4's 'Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy' Has Crushed My Wife's Spirit  Forbes Now

Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy My wife doesn’t play video games. Not any more, anyway. She doesn’t have time, first off. She’ll be a doctor now in a little under a year, and let me tell you, the process to get to that point does not leave much free time for gaming. And when she does have a spare moment, you can bet that I’m not teaching her the intricacies of the Destiny loot system, we’re watching Netflix instead. But that all changed with the Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy. She begged me to download it on PS4, which is certainly a first. It’s because she adores Crash Bandicoot, as he’s ...

item.title: 'Crash Bandicoot N Sane Trilogy' Has Sold Over 2.5 Million Copies On PS4 - Forbes Now
item.description:
'Crash Bandicoot N Sane Trilogy' Has Sold Over 2.5 Million Copies On PS4  Forbes Now

Crash Bandicoot has been a resounding success. Crash Bandicoot N Sane Trilogy, a remaster of three games from the classic platformer franchise, has sold over 2.5 million copies since its June 30th release date. That’s according to analyst Daniel Ahmad at Niko Partners, who tweeted the impressive figure Saturday: Was just looking over some numbers and noticed that Crash Bandicoot PS4 has already sold over 2.5 million units worldwide…… wow! pic.twitter.com/kHlbiYAz83 — Daniel Ahmad (@ZhugeEX) September 23, 2017 The game, which has been described by many as exceedingly difficult (and, weirdly,...

item.title: Maremma sheepdogs guarding endangered marsupials back into existence - ABC News
item.description:
Maremma sheepdogs guarding endangered marsupials back into existence  ABC News

It is an unlikely alliance between two animals from different parts of the world. How to help protect bandicoots - Keep dogs and cats inside at night - Create shelters in the garden such as big bushes or plant mounds - Water your lawn — dry grass makes it hard for bandicoots to find food - Create mulch mounds to give bandicoots extra food - Keep your eye out at night — road kill is a big problem The endangered eastern barred bandicoot, a solitary nocturnal animal extinct in mainland Australia's wild; and the shaggy white-blonde maremmas, an ancient Italian breed of guardian dogs. The dogs a...

item.title: 'Spyro Reignited Trilogy' Review: Keeper Of The Flame - Forbes
item.description:
'Spyro Reignited Trilogy' Review: Keeper Of The Flame  Forbes

Spyro Reignited Trilogy I was in middle school when the first Spyro title came out, and if memory serves, I visited our local mom-and-pop video store on release day to rent a freshly-opened copy. This was after months and months of fevered anticipation fueled by gaming magazine articles, PlayStation Underground and Official PlayStation Magazine demo discs, as well as a serious yearning for Sony’s answer to Super Mario 64, a 3D competitor that was fully compatible with my newly purchased DualShock controller. Needless to say, Spyro the Dragon, in addition to its two excellent sequels, are ki...

item.title: PlayStation Classic: Seven games deserving of a comeback on Sony's retro console - The Independent
item.description:
PlayStation Classic: Seven games deserving of a comeback on Sony's retro console  The Independent

The announcement by Sony that it is to launch the PlayStation Classic has gamers itching to get back into some beloved titles from the 1990s. Five pre-loaded games have been announced already – including heavyweights like Final Fantasy VII, Tekken 3 and Ridge Racer Type 4 – but there are hundreds more in the library. Although the Japanese electronics firm has promised “more fan favourites” will feature when the console is released in time for Christmas, thousands of retro game lovers will have their own suggestions. - Read more Ten of the PlayStation Classics’ greatest games Here are a few ...

item.title: 5 Reasons You Should Be Excited About The 'Spyro Reignited Trilogy' - Forbes Now
item.description:
5 Reasons You Should Be Excited About The 'Spyro Reignited Trilogy'  Forbes Now

Here are 5 reasons you should be excited by the new Spyro remaster. Spyro The Dragon is making a comeback. The popular video game character has appeared in Activision’s Skylanders series in recent years, but he hasn’t had his very own video game since the Legend of Spyro reboot trilogy back in 2006 – 2008. Now Activision and developer Toys For Bob, the studio behind the first Skylanders game Spyro’s Adventure, are releasing the Spyro Reignited Trilogy which lands this September. From everything we’ve seen there’s plenty to be excited about, especially given how good the Crash Bandicoot N.Sa...

item.title: Nintendo Direct: With Super Smash Bros. and more the Switch shows no sign of slowing down - The Telegraph
item.description:
Nintendo Direct: With Super Smash Bros. and more the Switch shows no sign of slowing down  The Telegraph

The Nintendo Switch celebrated its first birthday last week and what a year it has been for the fascinating home-and-handheld hybrid console. Originally written off as too quirky and too light on games to rekindle Nintendo’s fortunes in the hardware market; its flexibility, steady stream of outstanding releases and reissues of underplayed games has lead it to critical acclaim and commercial success. It is now the famous Japanese company’s fastest selling console of all time in the US. And in a new Nintendo Direct and the announcement of Super Smash Bros. for Switch, Nintendo show it has no ...

item.title: Activision May Be Planning New 'Crash Bandicoot' Games, 'N.Sane' Switch And PC Release - Forbes Now
item.description:
Activision May Be Planning New 'Crash Bandicoot' Games, 'N.Sane' Switch And PC Release  Forbes Now

Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy One of the biggest sleeper success stories of last year was no doubt Activision’s Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy, a remaster that surpassed their wildest sales expectations with little to nothing dumped into marketing. It even got my wife playing video games again, which is something I never thought I’d see, and it seems it had a similar effect on others. Today’s rumor comes via ResetEra (the new NeoGAF) where Max Arguile, Licensing Manager of GB Eye, a European merchandising company, says the following based on his own knowledge: - Activision is planning a ...

item.title: Calls for tougher animal cruelty penalties over bandicoot drowning - ABC News
item.description:
Calls for tougher animal cruelty penalties over bandicoot drowning  ABC News

The director of a Tasmanian wildlife sanctuary has called for tougher penalties for animal cruelty after a social media post allegedly showed a man drowning a bandicoot in front of two children. Bonorong Park's Greg Irons said the vision posted on Facebook showed a bandicoot trapped in a cage being place in a bucket of water. WARNING: This story contains photos some viewers may find distressing. Photo: The live bandicoot in the cage trap was put into a bucket of water, as the children looked on. (Supplied: Facebook) Do you think tougher penalties should be introduced for animal cruelty post...

item.title: Back from the brink — scientists fight to save the bandicoot - ABC News
item.description:
Back from the brink — scientists fight to save the bandicoot  ABC News

They are small, hairy and easily mistaken for rats, but scientists hope eastern barred bandicoots being released onto Phillip Island will bring the species back from the brink of extinction. The animals were wiped out in Victoria by foxes and habitat loss and for years have only existed in sanctuaries. Forty four eastern barred bandicoots were relocated as part of the first release onto Phillip Island, which was declared fox-free earlier this year after a decade long eradication program. The marsupials, captured from sanctuaries around the state, were given a vet check then release under th...

item.title: Indictment asked for 18 in tower crash (2) - Agenzia Ansa
item.description:
Indictment asked for 18 in tower crash (2)  Agenzia Ansa

(ANSA) - Genoa, November 3 - Prosecutors on Friday requested the indictment of 18 people and companies under investigation for the collapse in 2013 of a tower at the port of Genoa that killed nine people. The constructors of the Torre Piloti and the victims' employers are among those under investigation for the collapse, which occurred after the Jolly Nero ship crashed into it. According to prosecutors who have requested the indictments, the tower was built on a pier with no protection without taking into account the danger posed, for example, by ships maneuvering in front of it. T...
